did.abstract: Collection contains letters from brothers John, William, and George Hasler, to their parents, while stationed in various camps in Pennsylvania, Virginia, Maryland, and Tennessee. John writes of an expected battle in Richmond, and of the Petersburg campaign. Letter topics include family and money, health, camp life, weather, troop movements, and military pay.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Hasler family were residents of New York, New York; there were three sons. John Hasler was a member of the Light Battery E, 1st Pennsylvania Artillery in the Union army. George was in Company H of the 13th New York Infantry Volunteers.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains letters from brothers John, William, and George Hasler, to their parents, while stationed in various camps in Pennsylvania, Virginia, Maryland, and Tennessee. John writes of an expected battle in Richmond, and of the Petersburg campaign. Letter topics include family and money, health, camp life, weather, troop movements, and military pay.
